definitions.definition: The linkage in a ( watch ) that gives impulses to the timekeeping element and periodically releases the gear train to move forward, advancing the clock's hands.
examples: The escapement is the reason why clocks tick.

definitions.definition: A mechanism found in devices such as a typewriter or printer which controls lateral motion of the carriage .
An escape or a means of escape .
The number of fish that escape commercial fishing operations and travel upstream to spawn.

main_definition: ( clocks , mechanics ) The linkage in a ( watch ) that gives impulses to the timekeeping element and periodically releases the gear train to move forward, advancing the clock's hands.
